summary: This document contains due diligence research results for Richard Kahn, including various searches for negative media, public records, and voter registrations. It details personal information, professional licenses, and property records associated with Kahn, as well as connections to other individuals. The document emphasizes the importance of compliance and thorough review of the findings. This document contains various records related to individuals associated with the PennMont Securities LLP, including details about their permanent debarment from NYSE Arca. It lists multiple individuals, their roles, and the context of their debarment, indicating a significant legal action against them. Additionally, it includes information about Richard Kahn and his business affiliations. This document outlines the case United States of America v. Ippolito et al, detailing various attorneys involved, their roles, and the status of the case. It includes information about the charges against Matthew Finch, including conspiracy to impede or injure an officer, and the corresponding sentences and assessments. The case is noted as closed. This document outlines the verdicts related to various felony charges in the case of United States of America v. Ippolito et al. It details multiple counts of mailing threatening communications and conspiracy to impede or injure an officer, with several charges resulting in jury verdicts of not guilty. The document serves as a record of the terminated offenses and their outcomes.

events.title: Court Record Update
events.description: The court updated the record regarding the verdicts in the case of United States of America v. Ippolito et al.

keyFacts: Richard Kahn is the subject of a due diligence report with various searches conducted on him.
The report includes personal information such as voter registrations and professional licenses.
Beth Ann Kahn, Brittany N Kahn, Turner Francis Kahn, and Vincent Richard Kahn are identified as household members of Richard Kahn.
Francis Anthony Holland, Francis Holland Jr., Mary Ann Holland, and Asha S Holland are mentioned as associates of Richard Kahn.
The document emphasizes compliance and thorough review of findings related to Richard Kahn.
Richard Kahn and Keke Kahn are both listed as Limited Partners at PennMont Securities LLP and are subject to permanent debarment.
Multiple individuals associated with PennMont Securities LLP are mentioned as being permanently barred from NYSE Arca membership.
The document references various defendants in terminated cases, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.
Cynthia Kirkby, Sandra Sayre, and Donald Sayre are mentioned as sureties for various defendants.
The document contains a significant amount of information regarding legal actions and affiliations of individuals with PennMont Securities LLP.
Matthew Finch is facing multiple felony charges including conspiracy to impede or injure an officer.
The case is noted as closed as of the filing date.
Numerous attorneys are listed with many having been terminated at various dates.
Wilma L. Ippolito and Matthew Finch are co-defendants in the case.
The document includes detailed sentencing information for Matthew Finch.
Multiple felony charges related to mailing threatening communications were terminated.
Jury verdicts of not guilty were recorded for several counts, including conspiracy to impede or injure an officer.
The court updated the record on May 26, 2017.
